content.description:
The problem is an over hung juggy climb. Its currently a standing start but I'm sure a variation of a sit start could be added that would greatly increase the challenge.

 The Crux is the second to last move. It's not physically difficult, it's just a long right throw to a hidden jug when your about 10 feet off the ground. Fun stuff, try it if you're in the area.  Currently you just drop from the top, but I'm sure you could top out for some extra spice.
content.location: Down and around the main "crag" When walking from the north end down you should see the front of the boulder with unique rock formations. Follow the trail on the mountain side, (as opposed to Oceanside) around the boulder. After the trail loops nearly all the way around the boulder you should see some obvious jugs.

content.description: A simple problem on a wall. Fun, easy access, safe landing area. The Crux is close to the ground, the second and third moves. Finishes on a small ledge about 12 feet off the ground.
content.location: The start is about 10 feet past the bottom of the stairs on the trail.

content.description: The problem starts on a flake on the left. Climb toward the right and top out. To get down,  walk to where the trail gets close to the boulder,  down climb.  Perhaps have a friend bring a crash pad around.  Be wary of the top, there are many loose rocks, but the climb is solid below it.  I'll clean the top up next time I go back.
content.location: Far right, near the trail, looking south. Far right, near the beach looking north. The trail passes right by it.

content.description: Stand start, hands matched on 6 ft tall flake, basically two moves up and right to a clean topout. A sit start variation will exist for a stronger climber than me. Hop on this warmup while your here.
content.location: Same boulder as Life in Beaches, about 10 - 20 feet away.

content.description: An Oregon State Park right on the ocean. There are many boulders just to the south of the main parking lot. Only a few problems exist there right now, but there is potential. You can find traces of old exploration in the area, but nothing has been recorded.
